label: A rdfs:label
definition: AL definition@en
example of usage: A example of usage SPLIT=|
gross anatomical part: C ('is specified output of' some 'specimen collection process') and ('derives from' some %)
collection process input: C 'is specified output of' some ('specimen collection process' and 'has specified input' some %)

label: urine specimen
definition: a portion of urine collected from an organism
editor note: This could be instead a kind of collection of secreted stuff. Among secreted stuff there is passive, and active. urine is secreted, passiv.  lavage is secreted, active|are we happy calling collection of urine a material separation?|4/10/2011BP: It seems to me that the editor notes refer to a previous version, and are no longer relevant.

label: blood specimen
definition: a material entity derived from a portion of blood collected from an organism
example of usage: blood drawn from a human for glucose assay

label: sample from organism
definition: a material obtained from an organism in order to be a representative of the whole
editor note: we need to work on this: Is taking a urine sample a material separation process? If not, we will need to specify what 'taking a sample from organism' entails. We can argue that the objective to obtain a urine sample from a patient is enough to call it a material separation process, but it could dilute what material separation was supposed to be about.|5/29: This is a helper class for now

label: whole organism preparation
definition: A material entity which is the output of a process in which one or more whole organisms are prepared in a way to make it easier to study them, and in which the great majority of organismal parts are maintained
example of usage: putting a mouse in the blender. Not: putting a mouse on a scale
editor note: does this include injecting a dye to a patient to be able to visualize parts of his brain? If not, we should state that the components of the organism are substantially re-arranged.

label: material sample
definition: A material entity that has the material sample role
example of usage: blood drawn from patient to measure his systemic glucose level. A population of humans with HIV enrolled in a study taken to represent patients with HIV in general.

label: high molecular weight DNA extract
definition: The output of an extraction process in which DNA molecules above a molecular weight cutoff are purified in order to exclude DNA from organellas.
example of usage: Extraction of chromosomal DNA from mammalian cells by first isolating nucei

label: nuclear RNA extract
definition: A RNA extract that is the output of an extraction process in which RNA molecules found in the nucleus, including mRNA precursors (pre-mRNA), are extracted.
example of usage: Isolation and purification of nuclear RNA from animal cells using Norgen Bioteck corp. cytoplasmic and nuclear RNA purification kit (http://www.norgenbiotek.com/display-product.php?ID=30)

label: polyA RNA extract
definition: A RNA extract that is the output of an extraction process in which RNA molecules with poly A tail at its 3' end are purified.
example of usage: Preparation of polyA RNA by cellulose-bound oligo-dT (Aviv, H., Leder, P. 1972. Purification of biologically active globin messenger RNA by chromatography on oligothymidylic acid-cellulose. Proc. Nat. Acad. Sci. USA 69, 1408-1412.)

label: pre-mortem specimen
definition: a specimen that was taken from a live organism
example of usage: material obtained through a liver biopsy from a human patient
parent class: specimen with pre- or post-mortem status

label: cytoplasmic RNA extract
definition: A RNA extract that is the output of a RNA extraction process in which RNA molecules found in the cytoplasm are extracted.
example of usage: Cytoplasmic RNA extraction from mammalian tissues to create cDNA library (Carninci P, Nakamura M, Sato K, Hayashizaki Y, Brownstein MJ. Cytoplasmic RNA extraction from fresh and frozen mammalian tissues. Biotechniques. 2002;33:306–309.)

label: RNA extract
definition: an extract which is the output of an extraction process in which RNA molecules are isolated from a specimen.

label: total RNA extract
definition: A RNA extract that is the output of an extraction process in which total celluar and organelle RNA molecules are isolated from a specimen.
example of usage: Extraction of total RNA from cells with Qiagen mini RNeasy kit

label: organellar RNA extract
definition: A RNA extract that is the output of an extraction process in which RNA molecules found in an organelle, e.g., mitochondrion, ER, or chloroplast, excluding the nucleus, are extracted.
example of usage: Extraction of organellar RNA from plant cells using organellar RNA binding protein.

label: post mortem specimen
definition: a specimen that was taken from a dead organism
example of usage: the spleen taken from a dead mouse
parent class: specimen with pre- or post-mortem status

label: labeled DNA extract
definition: a labeled specimen that is the output of a labeling process and has grain labeled DNA to be able to detect DNA in future experiments.
editor note: Need to find out if we consider labeled nucleotides still nucleotides. It is after consulting with ChEBI group. Added duirng Mar 1, 2010 dev call
specimen collection process: ('addition of molecular label' and ('has specified input' some 'DNA extract'))

label: cloacal specimen
definition: A specimen obtained by inserting a swab deeply into the vent of the cloaca of an organism and vigorously swabbing the wall. The swab should be deeply stained with fecal material and is then placed in transport medium.
example of usage: type of sample used in the PCIRN influenza network

label: nasopharyngeal aspirate specimen
definition: A specimen which derives from nasopharyngeal mucosa after aspiration.
example of usage: type of sample used in the PCIRN influenza network

label: nasal swab specimen
definition: A specimen obtained using a cotton swab on a stick, passed up the nostril to obtain a sample of exudate and epithelial debris for microbiological or cellular examination.
example of usage: type of sample used in the PCIRN influenza network

label: labeled RNA extract
definition: a labeled specimen that is the output of a labeling process and has grain labeled RNA to be able to detect RNA in future experiments.
editor note: Need to find out if we consider labeled nucleotides still nucleotides. It is after consulting with ChEBI group. Added duirng Mar 1, 2010 dev call
specimen collection process: ('addition of molecular label' and ('has specified input' some 'RNA extract'))

label: frozen specimen
definition: A specimen that has been frozen in order to store it.
example of usage: Frozen blood plasma
specimen collection process: ('freezing storage' and ('has specified input' some ('has role' some 'specimen role')))

label: labeled specimen
definition: A specimen  that has been modified in order to be able to detect it in future experiments

label: paraffin specimen
definition: a specimen that is output of a paraffin storage process in which specimen is embedded in paraffin
example of usage: liver tissue embedded in paraffin
specimen collection process: ('paraffin storage' and ('has specified input' some ('has role' some 'specimen role')))

label: processed specimen
definition: A specimen that has been intentionally physically modified.
editor note: A tissue sample that has been sliced and stained for a histology study.

label: lyophilized specimen
definition: a specimen that is output of a lyophilization storage process in which specimen is lyophilized for storage.
example of usage: freezing dried DNA
specimen collection process: ('lyophilization storage' and ('has specified input' some ('has role' some 'specimen role')))

label: fresh specimen
definition: a specimen that is output of a specimen creation process used for an investigation without storage.
example of usage: a liver freshly removed from a rat

label: agar stab specimen
definition: a specimen that is output of a process that cell culture inoculated into agar for long term storage.
specimen collection process: ('agar stab storage' and ('has specified input' some ('has role' some 'specimen role')))

label: nucleic acid extract
definition: An extract that is the output of an extraction process in which nucleic acid molecules are isolated from a specimen.

label: DNA extract
definition: The output of an extraction process in which DNA molecules are purified in order to exclude DNA from organellas.

label: labeled nucleic acid extract
definition: a labeled specimen that is the output of a labeling process and has grain labeled nucleic acid for detection of the nucleic acid in future experiments.
specimen collection process: ('addition of molecular label' and ('has specified input' some 'nucleic acid extract'))

label: cell specimen
definition: A specimen primarily composed of a cell or cells collected from a multicellular organism or a cell culture.
term editor: PERSON: Chris Stoeckert, Jie Zheng, Alexander Diehl
editor note: Discussed on obi call Jan 23, 2017. To improve cell specimen that include single cell specimen. Details see tracker: https://sourceforge.net/p/obi/obi-terms/828

label: specimen with known storage state
definition: A specimen for which it is known whether it has been subjected to storage of a specified type.
associated axioms: 'fresh specimen' or ('specimen' and ('is specified output of' some 'storage'))

label: specimen from organism
definition: A specimen that derives from an anatomical part or substance arising from an organism. Examples of tissue specimen include tissue, organ, physiological system, blood, or body location (arm).

label: specimen with pre- or post-mortem status
editor preferred term: specimen with pre- or post-mortem status
definition: A specimen that has been established to be taken from a live (pre-mortem) or dead (post-mortem) organism.
editor note: organizational term, used in description of specimen that is created from known pre- or post-mortem status

label: H&E-stained fixed tissue slide specimen
definition: A fixed tissue slide specimen that is the output of H&E slide staining.

label: IHC-stained fixed tissue slide specimen
definition: A fixed tissue slide specimen that is the output of immunohistochemistry slide staining.

label: single cell specimen
definition: A cell specimen that contains only one cell.
editor note: Requested by Sirarat Sarntivijai (EBI). Details see tracker: https://sourceforge.net/p/obi/obi-terms/828/

label: amniotic fluid specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from amniotic fluid.

label: bile specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from bile.
parent class: digestive system fluid or secretion specimen

label: cerebrospinal fluid specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from cerbrospinal fluid.

label: feces specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from feces.

label: digestive system fluid or secretion specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from digestive system fluid or secretion.

label: milk specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from milk.

label: pericardial fluid specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from pericardial fluid.

label: saliva specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from saliva.

label: sputum specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from sputum.

label: sweat specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from sweat.

label: synovial fluid specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from synovial fluid.

label: vitreous humor specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from vireous humor.

label: bone marrow specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from bone marrow.

label: placenta specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from placenta.

label: peritoneal fluid specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from peritoneal fluid.

label: pleural fluid specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from pleural fluid.

label: brain specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from brain.

label: hair specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from hair.

label: prostate gland specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from prostate gland.

label: skeletal muscle tissue specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from skeletal muscle.

label: heart specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from heart.

label: renal medulla specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from renal medulla.

label: adrenal gland specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from adrenal gland.

label: breast specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from breast.

label: urinary bladder specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from urinary bladder.

label: tibial artery specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from tibial artery.

label: skin of body specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from skin.

label: pancreas specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from pancreas.

label: stomach specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from stomach.

label: pituitary gland specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from pituitary gland.

label: adipose tissue specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from adipose tissue.

label: cortex of kidney specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from cortex of kidney.

label: esophagus mucosa specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from esophagus mucosa.

label: colon specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from colon.

label: lung specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from lung.

label: esophagus muscularis mucosa specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from esophagus muscularis mucosa.

label: cerebral cortex specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from cerebral cortex.

label: thyroid gland specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from thyroid gland.

label: cerebellum specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from cerebellum.

label: tibial nerve specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from tibial nerve.

label: coronary artery specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from coronary artery.

label: spleen specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from spleen.

label: aorta specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from aorta.

label: atrial appendage specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from the atrium auricular region.

label: esophagogastric junction specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from the esophagogastric junction.

label: ileum specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from ileum.

label: liver specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from liver.

label: minor salivary gland specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from minor salivary gland.

label: omentum specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from omentum.

label: ovary specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from female gonad.

label: sigmoid colon specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from sigmoid colon.

label: suprapubic skin specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from suprapubic skin.

label: testis specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from testis.

label: uterus specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from uterus.

label: vagina specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from vagina.

label: polyA depleted RNA extract
definition: A RNA extract that is the output of an extraction process in which RNA molecules lacking poly A tails at thier 3' ends are purified.
term editor: PERSON: Chris Stoeckert|PERSON: Jie Zheng|Mark A. Miller, based on http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0000869

label: swab specimen
definition: A specimen that is stored on a swab as the output of a collecting specimen with swab process.

label: areolar swab specimen
definition: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of an areola of a breast.

label: breast swab specimen
definition: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of a breast.

label: cheek swab specimen
definition: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the cheek portion of the inside surface of a mouth.

label: nasopharyngeal swab specimen
definition: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of a nasopharynx.

label: oral swab specimen
definition: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the inside surface of a mouth.

label: oropharyngeal swab specimen
definition: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of a oropharynx.

label: rectal swab specimen
definition: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of a rectum.

label: tongue swab specimen
definition: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of a tongue.

label: vagina swab specimen
definition: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of a vagina.

label: fecal swab specimen
definition: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of a feces.

label: environmental swab specimen
definition: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of an environmenal material.

label: ribosomal RNA-depleted RNA extract
definition: An extract of RNA which is produced through rRNA (ribosomal RNA) depletion (the removal of highly abundant rRNA species).
example of usage: Looking at the reads for each ribosomal RNA-depleted RNA extract, the vast majority align to protein coding genes based on the ENSEMBL annotation.

label: individual organism specimen
definition: A specimen composed of an individual organism to be studied in an investigation.

label: arthropod meal of blood specimen
definition: A specimen of the blood ingested by an arthropod.
example of usage: A specimen used in a blood meal assay to determine what is the source of blood ingested by a mosquito.
editor note: The mosquito feeds on a human for example, ingests the blood of the human, this blood is then taken from the tummy of a mosquito and a PCR may be run on this specimen to identify that the mosquito definitely fed on a human.

label: induced sputum specimen
definition: A sputum specimen that is collected from an organism following its inhalation of a nebulized salt solution.

label: platelet-poor plasma specimen
definition: A blood plasma specimen that is the output of some platelet-poor plasma preparation and is the portion of plasma that contains fewer than 10,000 platelets per microliter.

label: tracheal aspirate specimen
definition: A specimen that is collected with a suctioning tube from the trachea.

label: mid-turbinate nasal swab specimen
definition: A specimen that is collected with a mid-turbinate nasal swab from the turbinate area of the nasal cavity.

label: nasal aspirate specimen
definition: A specimen that is collected with a suctioning tube from the nasal cavity.

label: lower respiratory tract aspirate specimen
definition: A specimen that is collected with a suctioning tube from the lower respiratory tract.

label: lower respiratory tract specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from the lower respiratory tract.

label: anterior nasal swab specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from the anterior nasal wall

label: endotracheal tube specimen
definition: A specimen that derives from a biofilm that forms on the inner surface of an endotracheal tube while the tube is in the trachea. The specimen is collected upon removal of the tube from the trachea.

label: endotracheal aspirate specimen
definition: A specimen that derives from a biofilm that forms on the inner surface of an endotracheal tube while the tube is in the trachea. The specimen is collected by suction without removing the tube.

label: blood specimen in vacutainer
definition: A blood specimen that is located in a vacutainer.

label: blood specimen on filter paper
definition: A blood specimen that is located on a filter paper.

label: placental blood specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from placental blood.

label: peripheral blood mononuclear cell specimen
definition: A processed specimen that is extracted from whole blood using gradient centrifugation that separates the blood into a layer of peripheral blood mononuclear cells under the top layer of plasma. It contains lymphocytes, monocytes or macrophages that are critical components in the immune system.

label: lymph specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from a portion of lymph collected from an organism.

label: digestive tract specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from part of a digestive tract.

label: nasal lavage fluid
definition: A specimen collected through nasal cavity lavage that contains the reagents used to for the lavage process, organisms, cells, cellular secretions, and other biomaterials present in the nasal cavity space.

label: albumin-free serum
definition: A blood serum specimen that contains no albumin.

label: lavage fluid specimen
definition: A specimen obtained through a lavage process which includes fluid in addition to cells and/or cellular secretions.
example of usage: The collection of bronchoalveolar lavage fluid (BAL) from the lungs of mice in order to study the cytokines present.

label: oral lavage fluid
definition: A specimen collected through oral cavity lavage that contains the reagents used to for the lavage process, organisms, cells, cellular secretions, and other biomaterials present in the oral cavity space.

label: blood plasma specimen
definition: a material entity which corresponds to the liquid component of blood, in which the blood cells are suspended.
example of usage: PMID: 18217225.Sex Transm Dis. 2008 Jan;35(1):55-60. Review.Human immunodeficiency virus viral load in blood plasma and semen: review and implications of empirical findings.
term editor: PERSON: Maura Gasparetto|PERSON: Melanie Courtot|PERSON: Philippe Rocca-Serra
editor note: 03/21/2010: BP, blood plasma is defined as the output of certain separation processes, so this is in the domain of OBI, not FMA.
specimen collection process: ('material component separation' and ('has specified input' some 'blood specimen'))

label: blood serum specimen
definition: A material entity which derives from blood and corresponds to blood plasma without fibrinogen or the other clotting factors.
example of usage: PMID: 18229666.Adv Med Sci. 2007;52 Suppl 1:204-6.Antioxidant activity of blood serum and saliva in patients with periodontal disease treated due to epilepsy.
term editor: PERSON: Maura Gasparetto|PERSON: Melanie Courtot|PERSON: Philippe Rocca-Serra
specimen collection process: (('filtration' or 'centrifugation' or 'dialysis') and ('has specified input' some 'blood specimen'))

label: bronchial alveolar lavage
definition: Group of biomaterials present in the bronchial aveolar space of an organism which are collected through lavage including the reagents used to for the lavage process, organisms, cells, and cellular secretions present in the bronchial aveolar space.
example of usage: solution containing lung derived T cells, eosinophils, and TNFa.

label: pool of specimens
definition: A pool of specimens is a mixture of a population of samples which have been gathered from one or more sample populations, obtained by the physical process of mixing individual specimens, e.g.  mixing the DNA collected from the individual fish.
editor note: check with advisors as to how to represent multiple instances of any class? a set of specimens which have been gathered from one or more sample_populations, obtained by the physical process of mixing individual specimens, e.g.  mixing the DNA collected from the individual fish

label: whole mount tissue
definition: A whole organism preparation resulting from a histological preparation known as whole mount preparation where the whole specimen is mounted or spread on the microscope (glass) slide
curator note: PRS:22-02-2008: indicates the need to create a protocol application and distinguish it from this entity|PRS:22-02-2008: is a material which has output_role during whole mount preparation protocol-application

label: lymph node cell specimen
definition: A cell specimen comprised of a mixed population of cells obtained by processing whole lymph node into individual cells, typically performed using a sieve. This population includes T cells, B cells, macrophages, and other cell types.
specimen collection process: ('organ harvesting' and ('has specified input' some 'lymph node'))

label: splenocyte specimen
definition: A cell specimen comprised of a mixed cell population obtained by processing whole spleen into individual cells, typically performed using a sieve or blender. This population includes T cells, B cells, macrophages, and other cell types.

label: FFPE specimen
definition: A specimen that has been fixed in formalin and embedded in paraffin.
example of usage: Many of today’s researchers prefer to use Formalin-Fixed Paraffin-Embedded samples of tissues for their IHC, histological or in-situ genomic analyses. Professionally fixed and embedded FFPE samples and the biomolecules they contain are reasonably stable at ambient temperatures. -based on https://lab-ally.com/histopathology-resources/ffpe-samples/

label: uterine cervix specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from some uterine cervix
definition source: Mark A. Miller ORCID:0000-0001-9076-6066|Christian Stoeckert ORCID:0000-0002-5714-991X
term editor: Mark A. Miller ORCID:0000-0001-9076-6066|Christian Stoeckert ORCID:0000-0002-5714-991X

label: urethra specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from some urethra
definition source: Mark A. Miller ORCID:0000-0001-9076-6066|Christian Stoeckert ORCID:0000-0002-5714-991X
term editor: Mark A. Miller ORCID:0000-0001-9076-6066|Christian Stoeckert ORCID:0000-0002-5714-991X

label: cervical mucus specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from some cervical mucus
definition source: Mark A. Miller ORCID:0000-0001-9076-6066|Christian Stoeckert ORCID:0000-0002-5714-991X
term editor: Mark A. Miller ORCID:0000-0001-9076-6066|Christian Stoeckert ORCID:0000-0002-5714-991X

label: throat specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from some throat

term editor: Mark A. Miller ORCID:0000-0001-9076-6066|Christian Stoeckert ORCID:0000-0002-5714-991X

label: eye specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from some eye
definition source: Mark A. Miller ORCID:0000-0001-9076-6066|Christian Stoeckert ORCID:0000-0002-5714-991X
term editor: Mark A. Miller ORCID:0000-0001-9076-6066|Christian Stoeckert ORCID:0000-0002-5714-991X

label: respiratory system specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from some respiratory system

definition: A specimen that is derived from some upper respiratory tract

term editor: Mark A. Miller ORCID:0000-0001-9076-6066|Christian Stoeckert ORCID:0000-0002-5714-991X

label: nasopharynx specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from some nasopharynx

term editor: Mark A. Miller ORCID:0000-0001-9076-6066|Christian Stoeckert ORCID:0000-0002-5714-991X

label: semen specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from some semen

label: bodily fluid specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from some bodily fluid
definition source: Mark A. Miller ORCID:0000-0001-9076-6066|Christian Stoeckert ORCID:0000-0002-5714-991X
term editor: Mark A. Miller ORCID:0000-0001-9076-6066|Christian Stoeckert ORCID:0000-0002-5714-991X

label: chorionic villus specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from some chorionic villus
definition source: Mark A. Miller ORCID:0000-0001-9076-6066|Christian Stoeckert ORCID:0000-0002-5714-991X
term editor: Mark A. Miller ORCID:0000-0001-9076-6066|Christian Stoeckert ORCID:0000-0002-5714-991X

label: meconium specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from some meconium

term editor: Mark A. Miller ORCID:0000-0001-9076-6066|Christian Stoeckert ORCID:0000-0002-5714-991X

label: umbilical cord blood specimen
definition: A specimen that is derived from some umbilical cord blood

definition: A specimen that is derived from some arterial blood
